abstract: Bank of America broadened its search for a chief executive officer to include candidates who want to live in New York, acknowledging the bank’s biggest units are no longer based in its home of Charlotte, North Carolina.
snippet: Bank of America broadened its search for a chief executive officer to include candidates who want to live in New York, acknowledging the bank’s biggest units are no longer based in its home of Charlotte, North Carolina.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America broadened its search for a chief executive officer to include candidates who want to live in New York, acknowledging the bank’s biggest units are no longer based in its home of Charlotte, N.C., Bloomberg News reported.

headline.main: Bank of America Said to Extend Search to N.Y.-Based C.E.O.’s

abstract: The Finger family of Texas, a large Bank of America shareholder, filed a notice Tuesday with the Securities and Exchange Commission calling on Kenneth D. Lewis, the bank’s chief executive, to recuse himself from any involvement in the board’s choice of his successor.

headline.main: Finger Family Asks: Is Bank of America a Monarchy?
